messages.content: ComfyUI-SyncTalk is a minimal port of the inference functionalities of the original SyncTalk, which uses NeRF based technology to create a talking head with synchronized lip movements.
Which operating system and Python version has ComfyUI-SyncTalk been tested on?
ComfyUI-SyncTalk has been tested on Ubuntu 22.04 with Python 3.12.5.
What are the dependencies of ComfyUI-SyncTalk?
The dependencies of ComfyUI-SyncTalk include pytorch3d and a forked version of SyncTalk for newer PyTorch versions.
To install ComfyUI-SyncTalk, users need to open the 'custom_nodes' folder and clone the repository. Some requirements will be installed automatically during the first start.
What is the purpose of building wheels for pytorch3d and other extensions in SyncTalk?
Building wheels for pytorch3d and other extensions in SyncTalk is necessary because there are usually no pre-built wheels available, and they need to be compiled on the user's machine.
What should users do before starting to work with ComfyUI-SyncTalk?

Before starting to work with ComfyUI-SyncTalk, users should download the training data and trained checkpoints from the original SyncTalk repository and place them in the correct locations under 'custom_nodes/ComfyUI-SyncTalk/repos/SyncTalk/'.
Which additional nodes are required for the ComfyUI-SyncTalk workflow?
The ComfyUI-SyncTalk workflow requires additional nodes from the ComfyUI-VideoHelperSuite, which users need to install in advance.
